page.title: 13THE REVEREND HILDYARD
page.content: The Reverend Hildyard seemed to be a very interesting man. He called himself Ingoldsby, after the village and always signed himself Ingoldsby in his letters. He wrote many letters about the revision of the Book of Common Prayer, these have been printed in a book known as The Ingoldsby Letters. The Reverend was taken to court in Victorian times because he thrashed a boy from the village.The boys name was Schofield, we think that there are some members of his family buried in the graveyard in Ingoldsby. He was fined Â£5 , the village policeman was also fined 10s. for helping him. The lime tree in front of the house is the same one under which the boy was thrashed.
